problems.title: Brush Not Spinning / Ratcheting Noise
problems.description: Loud noise when vacuuming carpet, or brush stopped.
solution_steps: The DC33 uses a clutch system, not a standard belt.
If the belt is snapped, you usually replace the whole clutch assembly (it's cheap and easier).
Check the dial on the front is set to 'Carpet'.

problems.title: No Suction from Hose
problems.description: Vacuum works on floor but not through the wand.
solution_steps: Check the U-bend pipe at the back for clogs.
Inspect the long yellow/grey stretch hose for tears.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a DC33 Multi-Floor Upright?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $523 vacuum, and extending the life of your Dyson is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my DC33 Multi-Floor Upright needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my DC33 Multi-Floor Upright myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
